heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 15 September 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-easterly (148°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (233.0°) by approximately 85.0 degrees.    In the UK, a south-easterly wind can bring cold and damp weather (especially in the winter.)

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1010 m), feels like temperature (up 3.3°C), and outside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 521.7m lower than yesterday, 504.8m lower than the past week, 1010.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 850m and a peak of 2900m, averaging 1025.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. The weather will likely remain the same.
